number of helpful: 63 of 80 people (79%) found this review helpful41 people found this review funny
content:
, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have never gotten into this franchise but my wife asked if this was available for Vr a few weeks ago. I just saw it pop up on the Vive Subreddit (great community there btw) and purchased it to suprise her. So far...she hasn't had a turn. Obviously....I had to test it first! It was much more fun playing than I ever thought it would have been. Not sure if it has to do with VR but I had a blast. Then I discovered the Arcade mode...thats even better!! I hear that the devs are going to put additional features, some new to the franchise for VR and that might add some additional value for the veterns. It runs great as well (using gtx 970). Be carefull though, I just broke my first wrist strap on my ceiling fan. Edited because I before E except after C...thanks phxrockerUpdate 8/4/2016: They just released a Survival mode and it so much fun! It is pretty hard as well. This is very different from any other version of Fruit Ninja and these little Helecopter baskets with a mounted cannon shoot fruit at you. Eventually, if you survive, more and more show up. The fun is when the bombs start shooting at you as well. Those you have to duck and dodge. Really fun and so worth the price!

content:
, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Full Review: http://uploadvr.com/fruit-ninja-vr-htc-vive-early-access-review/Summary:While Fruit Ninja VR is incredibly addicting, easy to jump into for newcomers, and tons of fun to play in its own right, it does feel a bit shallow in its current state. You can expect it to grow significantly over time considering it already has a strong foundation. Halfbrick Studios have proven that Fruit Ninja VR is the prime example of how to take a simple concept and adapt it to the uniquely immersive medium of virtual reality.Pros:- Incredibly addicting- Fun, varied game modes- New mechanics like stabbing- Bright and colorful visualsCons:- Feels a bit shallow on content- Sometimes the physics feel offFinal Score: 8/10 - GREATNote: UploadVR uses multiple Steam accounts across multiple editors and locations. Hours logged do not necessarily reflect all time spent in the game.

number of helpful: 34 of 55 people (62%) found this review helpful
content:
y 11
												It's Fruit Ninja!  IN VR! How cool is that?Honestly.. not very.The reason this was fun on the phone (that we played probably mostly while our wives shop or while bored on the toilet) was that it was fun for about 5 minutes at a time and it was kind of challenging.  Sort of.Well, that just doesn't translate very well to a full-fledged game where you're literally a captive audience since you went and put on all your VR stuff.  You literally get bored with this faster than it took to unplug your remotes, wipe your vr lenses, plug in your headset, unwind your cords and actually start the game.Not a good choice unless you're just a big, big fan of pointless arm swinging.  This entire experience is little more than waving your hands left and right quickly.  Literally.  That's it.  Oh, sorry you can "skewer" fruit.  Because, that's fun I guess?Well, beyond boredom, there are some other issues:The area you're in is low-poly and pointless (you can't interact with anything nor move)The machines that shoot the fruit in certain game modes are pointless and distractingThe tubes that shoot up fruit are too widely spaced for the FoV on the VR headset, so prepare for some nausea-inducing left and right head swinging for the entire game.Don't buy this unless it's DEEPLY discounted.  There's literally nothing more to this game than swinging your arms left and right.

content:
7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kinda neutral on this one - I didn't hate it, but I didn't exactly love it either. My wife had a lot of fun when she realised that she could skewer the fruit instead of just slicing it, and I had some fun messing around with the physics throwing fruit up in the air trying to catch it in my mouth (I do not recommend trying this with Watermelons in real life), but otherwise it plays pretty much exactly the same as the mobile version - just in VR.One disadvantage of this version over the mobile version is that the limited FOV in current generation headsets means you often won't see the fruit fly up on your sides (I figured out a trick though - keep an eye on the shadows).It has the same game modes as the mobile version - Zen (no bombs), Classic (slow paced) and Arcade (fast paced), but I would have really liked some more content since PC > mobile (like the various sword fighting games in Wii Sports & Wii Sports Resort)... but I can't fault it for delivering exactly what it promised on the tin.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
1, 2016
Early Access Review
								I am writing this review from inside of my iphone. I don't know how I got in here... But its absolutely incredible! Fruit Ninja VR is a must have game for the Vive, just as Fruit Ninja was a must have app for any smartphone owner! Halfbrick really found a great way to take an old franchise, and put it into a whole new light! Fruit Ninja has officially been...Re"Vive"d!The moment you put on your headset, you are greeted with three different gamemode options, all included in the original smartphone game. The first mode is Arcade. This mode has you going up against the clock to see how many points you can earn within a one minute time frame. Combos and bonuses are your friend here, so be sure to rack up as many as you can. All bombs must be avoided, as slicing one would result in an instant "Game Over!"The second mode is Classic. Here you must slice as many fruit as you can while attempting to avoid the oncoming bombs. Failing to slice a fruit that you are presented with before it hits the ground will earn you a strike. Three of these, and "Your out!" The goal in this mode is to gain as many points as possible within an infinite amount of time. The third and final mode is Zen. While very similar to Arcade mode, it does have its differences. There are zero bombs in this mode, and your main focus is slicing fruit and earning combos. There is also a time limit that you are up against. You have 90 seconds to slice, dice, and cut as many of those fruits that you possibly can.I personally find all three of these modes to give an equal amount of enjoyment. The leaderboards for each gamemode are one of the greatest aspects of this game. Attempting to go for the communities high score is very addictive and a ton of fun!  Graphically this game is gorgeous! The animated cartoony style looks and feels really cool in VR! The swords are shiny and reflective, the background is visually pleasing, and all the small elements of this game are very detailed and polished.All of the sound effects in this game are actually pretty nostalgic. Many of them are taken straight from the original game, and it fits so perfectly in this one.The controls of this game are so simple, that if you have arms, you can play. Slicing is the only required movement in this game, and there is not a single button that you must press to activate anything! Not only are the controls simple, but they are very intuitive. There have been no occurrences of any missed fruit slicing or bomb hits that have not been my own fault. Don't mistake having the fruit or bomb bounce off your sword as a glitch. You must slice them, not just let your sword touch them. The swords move around beautifully, and even make a swooshing sound when you swing them. If the amount of content is what's holding you back from buying this game, don't fret. Its still incredible at its current state + Multiplayer, new maps, and new weapons are on the way. This game is still in early access. The next generation of ninja fruit slicing is here...And its wonderful!

Early Access Review
								9/10Reasoning:Most of the negative reviews for this game say "Shallow in content"; my response to that is:IT IS FRUIT NINJA!!!This game is just like the app that many of us used to play a few years ago, or even continue to play, the only difference being it is better. It includes new mechanics such as making a 'shishkebab' out of fruit, or pushing bombs aside... you feel like a real fruit ninja...My reasoning behind not giving it a  10/10 even though I am praising it so much is the simple fact that the sensitivity could be better... That's it. Sometime, very occasionally you try pushing a bomb and even though you are going slow, it explodes, or you try stabbing it and it just pushes it, that is all that I can say really, thank you for reading, enjoy your day!

er 16, 2016
												Ive played fruit ninja on smartphones, ive played fruit ninja on stupid phones, i played fruit ninja with the tracker thing whose name ive forgotten, ive played fruit ninja with the kinect (xbox 360), and now ive played fruit ninja in VR. This game is fun as hell. have some people come over, and get your ninjafreak on!! beating your own highscores is what will keep you going, and as it was with the kinect, with motion controllers in VR, you break a sweat rather quick! its kind of a work out at some point! Thy shallst drink enough water! its not a game youll play for hours at a time, but it brilliant to relax a bit from all that killing and destroying in other games. i for one, like it a lot, and recommend it as a game!

												Not recommended at all. Looks very polished so good job there but there is very little gameplay (less than the original it feels like) and the mechanics just don't work that well. Generally the difficulty levels are unfun and players get overwhelmed too quickly. I had everyone in our office have a go at all our VR games over the holiday and this was skipped pretty quick. I don't write many reviews but this should be a pass for VR fans. In general these VR titles are overpriced for what they offer and it this is a great example of that. $5-10 game at most.  (MIGHT be better for kids)

content:
y 4
												This might be a fun game for children, but it is not a fully fleshed out game in any way.  You can "slice" the fruit in half with the flat of your blade (simply impossible with a "real" sword unless you are baseball-bating it) or the back of your blade.Additionally, it doesn't really have much to add beyond what you get for the free phone game.While I've never returned a game before, this one is getting refunded.  It is DEFINITELY NOT in any way shape or form a $15 game.  If it was $5, I'd keep it...but this is not worth it at all to me (and I've kept terrible VR games just to further the the VR market).  This game is just overpriced for what they are trying to sell it for and they are just trying to cash in on the name recognition from the mobile phone game.  I'm going to wait for Zen Blad to come back which seems like a much better game from what I have been able to read.

content:
r 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I had a mild addiction to Fruit Ninja on Android some years back, and are very familiar with the concept and game modes.What can I say, they did it again. The very simplistic concept which worked wonders on the fairly new smartphone touchscreens, applies to the freedom of VR just as well.It's the same game, with better and way more fun controls! The game modes are still very addictive, and the new "Survival mode", where flyinf robots shoots barrages of fruit at you, gives a little more depth, allthough it feels a little gimmicky.Can't get enough of Classic and Zen mode! Arcade hurts my arms and shoulders xDA must-have for Fruit, Sword and/or VR fans!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
20, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is my favorite VR game by far!  The physics are realistic enough to feel satisfying and fake in a way that makes you feel stronger and more talented than you would be in real life.  The katanas feel very light and with the flick of your wrist you can slice a coconut in half or send a bomb flying up in the air.  The stereo audio is pretty well done and offers enough cues so that you know when a piece of fruit pops up outside of your range of vision.  I think they've squeezed as much technology into this game as possible making it one of the richest vr experiences I've seen so far.  And the music is great too.  I would recommend playing in a large play area if possible. I'm not sure how good the game is in a cramped space.

								So let me start with saying I really like this game.  I've never played the app Fruit Ninja so I don't know why I really wanted this game in the first place.  That being said, I'm not sure the game is worth $15 for what it is. If you're on a budget, I wouldn't buy the game in it's current state or I'd wait for it to go on sale.

I personally rate this game 8/10 with more fixes in the mechanics of the swords or maybe even different types of swords to use and customize. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
ry 23
												One of my favorite sword games.  Great to jump in and out quick to relax after work.  Graphics and VR experience are very solid.  You do stand in fixed postion with only ability to turn 360 degrees.  Most of the fruit action occurs in front of you (not from behind)  You only have one scene or play area.  The physics of the fruit are very good as far as slicing, stabbing, and tap bumping items such as bombs to the side.  Highly recommend if you enjoy sword style games.  The physics in manipulating the fruit movement with swords are spot on. Modeling of katanas are very good as well.  Look forward to updates.  I would like to see upgrades to style of different swords, maybe things to collect, or change of scenery.   Game is mostly point based to gain highest score.  Very good quality VR title that looks and feels polished.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
y 26
												Tons of fun and the accuracy is great. You can stab fruit, slice individually from any direction, do combos for more points, and smack bombs aside with the side of the blade. Great game to show people who won't be into shooters or scary heights games. There's don't let any fruit fall mode, score as much as possible without hitting bombs mode, and just score as much as possible mode, but my favorite is survival mode. All the other modes deal mostly with horizontal cuts, but in survival mode canons launch fruit at you so your cuts are usually going away from you rather than side to side. It really makes a difference slashing away and I like how that switches it up.
